Class TitleScreenController

java.lang.Object
java.util.Observable
controller.TitleScreenController
All Implemented Interfaces:
KeyListener, EventListener
public class TitleScreenController extends Observable implements KeyListener
controller of the TitleScreenView, game entry point. handles the keyboard inputs of the user when he is in the title screen, and starts the game via startMainGame(boolean) if the user selects 'new game' or 'play tutorial'. the method handles the initialization of the models, views and controllers of the game.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    private Set<Integer>
    pressedKeys
    a set containing the currently user pressed keys had to use this because otherwise when the user presses a key, multiple notifications get sent to the audio manager, so it caused multiple sounds (too many) if the user held down a key
    private final TitleScreenView
    titleScreenView
    reference to the TitleScreenView view
    private final JFrame
    window
    reference to the JFrame created in the Main

  • Field Details

    • window

      private final JFrame window
      reference to the JFrame created in the Main

    • titleScreenView

      private final TitleScreenView titleScreenView
      reference to the TitleScreenView view

    • pressedKeys

      private Set<Integer> pressedKeys
      a set containing the currently user pressed keys had to use this because otherwise when the user presses a key, multiple notifications get sent to the audio manager, so it caused multiple sounds (too many) if the user held down a key

  • Constructor Details

    • TitleScreenController

      public TitleScreenController(JFrame window, TitleScreenView titleScreenView)
      controller, handles the user keyboard inputs when he is in the title screen. entry point of the game, so it handles the game startup via startMainGame(boolean) or the leaderboard view if the user selects 'leaderboard' in the title screen.
      Parameters:
      window - JFrame window created in Main
      titleScreenView - TitleScreenView view

  • Method Details

    • keyTyped

      public void keyTyped(KeyEvent e)
      Specified by:
      keyTyped in interface KeyListener

    • keyPressed

      public void keyPressed(KeyEvent e)
      handles key pressed when the user is in the title screen. the user can press the arrow keys to navigate the title screen and enter key to select the option. notifies AudioManager to play a sound when a key is pressed. when the user confirms the selected option with the 'enter' key, handleEnterInput() method is called handle the keypress.
      Specified by:
      keyPressed in interface KeyListener
      Parameters:
      e - the event to be processed

    • keyReleased

      public void keyReleased(KeyEvent e)
      Specified by:
      keyReleased in interface KeyListener

    • handleEnterInput

      private void handleEnterInput()
      handles the enter key press. if the user selected 'new game', the startMainGame(boolean) gets called that connect every single controller / view. the boolean 'play tutorial' will gets set to false, and LevelManager will load the default world layout. if the user selected 'play tutorial' the startMainGame(boolean) gets called that connect every single controller / view. the boolean 'play tutorial' will gets set to true, and LevelManager will load the tutorial world layout. if the user selected 'leaderboard', then the LeaderboardView and LeaderboardViewController get created to display the leaderboard. if the user selected 'exit game', exits the game.

    • startMainGame

      private void startMainGame(boolean playTutorial)
      creates and connects the required models, controllers and views of the game. asks LevelManager to initialize the tutorial layout if the playTutorial flag is set to true, asks LevelManager to initialize the default game world layout if the playTutorial flag is set to false. note that if the user selects the 'new game' option, he will be brought to the WhatsYourNameView to enter his name for the Leaderboard.
      Parameters:
      playTutorial - used to select what world layout will get initialized in the LevelManager. if true, then the tutorial layout will get initialized. if false, then the default game world layout will get initialized.

    • displayLeaderboard

      private void displayLeaderboard()
      handles the creation/display of the LeaderboardView and LeaderboardViewController.
